title: (x) Der Förster von Silberwald German movie poster (1950s) - hand lettered {Adriano S}
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140830113930im_/http:/typophile.com/files/50s_4625.jpg)

Dear Font-Freaks,  
i need to know the name of these TWO fonts  
in this picture (arrows). I think, it must be  
50s fonts or any retro-types.

They are from an old german movie-poster  
from the 50s.

It would be sooo nice, if you could  
help me to identify them.

Thank you  
Gigi

\*(sorry for my bad english) ;)
author: Carpio

comments.content: More than likely hand-written/painted. You can see the differences in the repeating glyphs.

I`m guessing FF DIN for this nike RUN publicity, but I`d very much like to confirm it...UMMMM-K?!

[http://liverun.blogtvbrasil.com.br/2007/09/20/nike-10k-abre-inscricoes](http://web.archive.org/web/20140830113930/http:/liverun.blogtvbrasil.com.br/2007/09/20/nike-10k-abre-inscricoes "http://liverun.blogtvbrasil.com.br/2007/09/20/nike-10k-abre-inscricoes")

Giulio, welcome to Typophile. You need to start a separate thread for a new type ID. Please read the Type ID Forum FAQ, as it will help ensure that the right people see your request quickly.

[http://typophile.com/forum/typeid/faq](http://web.archive.org/web/20140830113930/http:/typophile.com/forum/typeid/faq "http://typophile.com/forum/typeid/faq")

No, that's something more like [Tasse](http://web.archive.org/web/20140830113930/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Tasse). In the future, please start a new topic if you have a different typeface to ID.

THANK YOU VERY MUCH!  
Your threads helped me a lot! And I read the  
"Type ID Forum FAQ" now... ;) Sorry.

Yours  
Carpio :-)
